venue.address_1: located on SR3 near Trudeau Rd
venue.name: Beaver Brook Picnic Area

item.description:
Hiking Galehead, and the Twins, Saturday March 16th.

We will start at Beaver Brook and traverse through to Little River Road, approximately 14.1 miles.

Everyone will be waitlisted so I can get a feel for how prepared you are for this hike. I will require a phone number for last minute communications if needed. Please RSVP before Thursday March 14 at 7 PM, earlier is better. This hike is very dependent on good weather conditions. I am limiting this hike to about 10 people.

I will have my black lab Bond with me. I will allow other dogs as long as they are well behaved, in shape, and have done similar winter hikes.

I will be bringing my butt sled but am not sure what the trail conditions may be.

This is a moderate to advanced hike, you are responsible for yourself and are expected to have all necessary winter gear and clothing. For your reference if you need it is a link to AMC’s list for Essential Winter Gear for Northeastern Hikes, http://www.outdoors.org/publications/outdoors/2002/2002-winter-gear.cfm

I am from NH and have posted this on Meetup and MOAC sites and will try to allow members from both to attend. I could carpool from LL Bean Parking lot in Concord NH or other points.  I may consider leaving a little earlier and having a good breakfast in Twin Mtn before starting. I can help coordinate carpooling from Maine by sharing your email with others from Maine if you ask me to in your email.

I would need someone to arrive a little earlier to spot a car on Little river road.

I would like to stop at the Woodstock in or other establishment for post hike “refueling”

Disclaimer

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code; http://hikesafe.com/index.php?page=hiker-responsibility-code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Silver VW Jetta, friendly black lab
item.name: Galehead and the Twins, finish my winter 4Ks!
